POMPEU.name: POMPEU
POMPEU.address: Carrer de Roc Boronat, 138, 08018 Barcelona, Spain

sessions.title: Welcome and Introductions (Open to Public)
sessions.details: Welcoming words by Pompeu Fabra University and GAIA team.

signup.text: Members of the public must register. GAIA attendees are pre-registered.

sessions.title: Talk / Performance (Open to Public)
sessions.details: Opening talk by Roc Parés i Burguès - In becoming: Art practice as research

signup.text: Members of the public must register. GAIA attendees are pre-registered.

sessions.title: The Scene Report + Roundtable (Open to Public)

signup.text: Members of the public must register. GAIA attendees are pre-registered.

sessions.title: Games + Play (Private session)
sessions.details: Exploring the translations of play, fun, and games in different cultures.

sessions.title: Scene Report (Private session)
sessions.details: GAIA participants share a snapshot update on their current projects.

sessions.title: GACK2 (Private session)
sessions.details: Collective workshop on the Game Arts Curatorial Kit volume 2, focusing on case studies of game events, festivals, and exhibitions worldwide.

sessions.title: Gamelab showcase (Open to Public)
sessions.details: Showcase of the videogame projects that are been incubated at the Pompeu Gamelab + pica pica

signup.text: Members of the public must register. GAIA attendees are pre-registered.

sessions.title: Sustainability Roundtable (Private session)
sessions.details: Discussion on running long-term initiatives, maintaining motivation, avoiding burnout, and keeping communities fresh and exciting over 5+ years.

sessions.title: Public Sector Hustle (Private session)
sessions.details: Making it work! How we hustle, from public sector organizations, NGOs, and foundations.

sessions.title: Non-interactive Exhibits (Private session)
sessions.details: Exploring exhibition strategies for displaying videogames in art contexts, the place of spectatorship, and making invisible game content visible to audiences.

sessions.title: Browser Museums (Private session)
sessions.details: Building new online platforms for curating and accessing games, including 3D multi-user browser exhibitions and alternatives to algorithmic recommendations.

sessions.title: Playformance! (Open to Public)
sessions.details: Playformance blends video games, performance, and critical reflection. This practice. coined by French collective Sous les néons uses the act of play to tell stories, spark meaning, and question the systems inside digital worlds. What does it mean to play with intention? To resist, to be moved, to perform together? This session features Celeste by Diane Landais and Ghost Recon: Wildlands by Hugo Sastre-Fournès.

sessions.title: Global South Curators (Private session)
sessions.details: Two perspectives on game development advocacy: self-producing game jams in the Philippines and 11 years of supporting the African game development ecosystem.

sessions.title: Fighting back (Private session)
sessions.details: Videogame co-ops, collective organizations, and game arts initiatives as alternatives

sessions.title: Outdoors! Unconference (Private session)
sessions.details: Open session led by all participants to discuss emerging topics and collaborative ideas

sessions.title: DemoDay (By invitation)
sessions.details: Demo Day is the grand finale of GameBCN’s 10th incubation program. GAIA’s delegation will join the celebration and will get to know this year’s GameBCN cohort, play their games, test new projects, connect with the local scene, and discover the future of the Catalan games industry. This event is possible thanks to the Ajuntament de Barcelona, Generalitat de Catalunya, Peninsula Corporate Innovation, and partners like Socialpoint, Gameloft Barcelona, FunPlus, Ubisoft Barcelona, Tilting Point, IO Interactive, Anchor Point Studios, and Marvelous.

signup.text: Members of the public must register. GAIA attendees are pre-registered.
